summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to United Airlines Corporate Security, dated January 23, 2020. It commands the production of passenger and other records for Ghislaine Maxwell and three other individuals (names redacted) for specified time periods (1994-1998 and 2019 onward) as part of a federal criminal investigation into violations including sex trafficking. The document includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney / Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, requesting records from United Airlines as part of a federal criminal investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Listed as an individual for whom the grand jury subpoena demands all passenger, payment, membership, or loyalty records from United Airlines for the periods January 1, 1994, through December 31, 1998, and July 1, 2019, through the date of service.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for United Airlines
events.description: The subpoena commands United Airlines Corporate Security to appear before the Grand Jury at the U.S. Courthouse in New York to testify and produce records, though a personal appearance is waived if records are produced to the FBI by that date.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena to United Airlines
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a grand jury subpoena to United Airlines Corporate Security, demanding travel records for Ghislaine Maxwell and others as part of a federal criminal investigation.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
Federal Bureau of Investigation, 26 Federal Plaza, VCAC/Human Trafficking, New York, NY 10278
The Silvio J. Atollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to United Airlines on January 23, 2020, seeking passenger and other records for Ghislaine Maxwell and three other individuals (names redacted in the document).

The investigation concerns alleged violations of federal criminal law, specifically citing statutes 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion and enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).
The subpoena requests records for two distinct time periods: January 1, 1994, through December 31, 1998, and July 1, 2019, through the date of service in January 2020.

The U.S. Attorney's Office included a specific request for non-disclosure, asking United Airlines not to reveal the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing investigation.
The document indicates the investigation was active and ongoing as of January 2020, focusing on gathering travel evidence potentially related to sex trafficking allegations.
